messages.content: What is the purpose of AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio?
AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio aims to improve the interactive experience of using ComfyUI by making the loading of ComfyUI models more intuitive and facilitating the creation of model thumbnails.
What are some key features of AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio?

Some key features of AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio include a more intuitive model management system, one-click generation of model thumbnails, the ability to exclude certain models from appearing in the loader, automatic model labeling, and model matching workflow.

To install AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio, you need to place it in the 'custom_nodes' folder in ComfyUI. You can do this by running the command: 'cd ComfyUI/custom_nodes' followed by 'git clone https://github.com/AIGODLIKE/AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio.git'.

To use AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio, find a loader and left click on the model switch to pop up the ComfyUI Studio Manager. If you need to use the original model list, use Shift+left click on the model switch.
What are the two types of loaders supported by AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio?

AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio supports two types of loaders: Standard Node, which automatically supports ComfyUI official nodes and standard named custom node types, and Non-standard nodes, which require manual adaptation due to redefined model loaders.
What are some of the Non-standard nodes supported by AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio?

Some of the Non-standard nodes supported by AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio include ImageOnlyCheckpointLoader, CheckpointLoaderSimple, unCLIPCheckpointLoader, CheckpointLoader, VAELoader, CLIPVisionLoader, GLIGENLoader, ControlNetLoader, DiffControlNetLoader, LoraLoaderModelOnly, LoraLoader, StyleModelLoader, UpscaleModelLoader, HypernetworkLoader, CLIPLoader, DualCLIPLoader, UNETLoader, and DiffusersLoader.
What are some of the planned future improvements for AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio?
Some of the planned future improvements for AIGODLIKE-ComfyUI-Studio include adding more support for functions and improving TAG filtering interaction.
